segments.text: Oh no, the sink is overflowing, water everywhere—it's terrifying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's right there, but she hasn't noticed the puddle at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What if she slips on the wet floor?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Look at that boy on the stool; it's tilting backward!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He could fall and hit his head on the counter.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His hand's in the cookie jar, but the height is so dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's reaching up too; she might get knocked over if he tumbles.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water's streaming down the cabinets—could cause a short or something worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the stool holds; my heart is racing watching this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open window shows a safe garden, but inside it's a hazard zone.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes could break if anyone falls into them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This unnoticed trouble is making me so anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone has to intervene before an accident happens.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't look away; it's too scary.
segments.speaker: PAR
